intelligence_requirement: Short-Term Trajectories of North Koreaâ€™s Military Power Development

H1.title: Rapid and Visible Organizational Capability Expansion
H1.description: This hypothesis suggests that the organization significantly increases its overall capacity in the short term through accelerated development, increased output, and more frequent public demonstrations of capability.

H2.title: Qualitative System Integration and Performance Optimization
H2.description: This hypothesis proposes that the organization prioritizes improving quality, efficiency, and internal integration rather than expanding size or volume of activities.

H3.title: Resource-Constrained Development and Operational Slowdown
H3.description: This hypothesis assumes that external constraints and limited resources slow overall development, resulting in reduced activity levels and incremental rather than transformative change.

H4.title: Externally Supported Capability Enhancement Through Partnerships
H4.description: This hypothesis suggests that capability growth is primarily enabled by external collaboration, knowledge transfer, or resource sharing rather than internal innovation.

H5.title: Deliberate Stabilization and Status Quo Maintenance Strategy
H5.description: This hypothesis proposes that the organization intentionally maintains its current capability level, avoiding major expansion or reduction in order to preserve stability.
